image.altText: Luke stands looking out at water, in shadow to disguise him.

props.synopsis: Luke was only minutes into his first shift at his new workplace when he began hearing his colleagues making homophobic comments. Despite being a resident of Australia's most progressive city, he says he no longer feels safe in public.

title.children: In Australia's most progressive city, Luke quit his job because of homophobia

image.altText: Police tape in front of a street with a house and cars in background.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating after a 71-year-old man who allegedly shot at officers during an attempted arrest was later found dead on a property in Canberra's south.

title.children: Man who allegedly shot at police during DV-related arrest found dead

image.altText: A delicate yellow orchid flower, on the end of its green stem.

props.synopsis: Australian cemeteries have become a safe haven for flora and fauna affected by urban expansion, including a rare orchid unique to a small patch of the NSW Mid North Coast.

title.children: Rare orchids and wattles thrive in old cemeteries

image.altText: A young Lebanese man bushwalking.

props.synopsis: A community-led hiking program is introducing migrants to the bush, offering moments of connection, discovery and, for some, a sense of safety.

title.children: 27 migrants went bushwalking hoping to shatter some myths

image.altText: People holding Australian flags outside Parliament House in Canberra.

props.synopsis: Sovereign citizens are clogging up Australian courts, after the global financial crisis and COVID-19 spurred a surge in the group's numbers in Australia.

title.children: A growing number of sovereign citizens are clogging up courts

image.altText: A group of Aboriginal family members.

props.synopsis: The family of a 17-year-old Indigenous boy says he was racially profiled when he was pulled from a Canberra bus by police officers who handcuffed him before realising he was the wrong person.

title.children: Aboriginal teen mistakenly pulled from bus at gunpoint after 'racial profiling'

image.altText: Map of cyclone on WA coast

props.synopsis: Residents in far-north WA are being warned of expected damaging wind and heavy rain today as Cyclone Fina approaches the Kimberley region.

title.children: Far-north WA residents warned to expect damaging wind and heavy rainfall

image.altText: Murray Watt frowns.

props.synopsis: A self-imposed deadline to have reforms to Australia's environment laws passed before Christmas is inching closer as minister Murray Watt looks to clinch a deal with either the Coalition or the Greens. Follow live.

title.children: Labor's self-imposed deadline for environment reforms looms

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: NDIS founder says scheme currently a 'trainwreck'
'No doubt' environment reforms to pass this week: Watt
Watt 'not happy' with $96m bill for BOM redesign

image.altText: Murray Watt stands in front of microphones with people wearing red shirts behind him.

props.synopsis: As politicians converge on Canberra for the last time this year, Labor is determined to pass its environment law reform and insists it will work with either the Coalition or the Greens to do so.

title.children: Watt declares 'now or never' for environment laws as stand-off looms

image.altText: A satellite view shows water in a dam surrounded by mountains

props.synopsis: As Iran suffers through a drought and the president warns the capital could be evacuated, millions are worried about what the future will hold.

title.children: Iran facing 'water bankruptcy' after years of overuse exacerbated by drought

image.altText: A headshot of Sussan Ley speaking.

props.synopsis: The optics of rolling the Liberal Party's only woman leader when NSW and Victoria have managed to elevate traditional "small-l liberal" candidates is playing on the minds of some members.

title.children: Ley faces big test and also a big opportunity in final week

image.altText: An orange BHP logo on a grey background.

props.synopsis: Preliminary talks between miners BHP and Anglo American end without a deal. Renewed hopes of a December rate cut powered Wall Street higher, while the ASX is set to follow suit. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: BHP unable to reach takeover deal with Anglo American

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Breaking: BHP no longer considering Anglo takeover
Wall Street rebounds on rate cut hopes, ASX set to recoup some losses

image.altText: A man shreiks and holds a chainsaw on a stage

props.synopsis: The department, established by Donald Trump and once headed up by Elon Musk, promised to slash billions from the US government but has quietly faded into the background in recent months.

title.children: 'Doesn't exist': White House disbands DOGE months early

image.altText: England cricket coach Brendon McCullum stands on the ground with his cap on backwards as a player watches.

props.synopsis: Brendon McCullum says England will find itself in trouble if it abandons Bazball now, with the team to double down on its aggressive tactics heading into Brisbane.

title.children: Keep calm and Bazball: McCullum plots England's Ashes turnaround

image.altText: Max Verstappen raises the trophy in one hand over aloft

props.synopsis: Here is how the drivers' championship is poised with two rounds remaining.

title.children: How McLaren's double-disqualification has changed the F1 title race

image.altText: Roslyn Grima sits on a bench, with bush behind her.

props.synopsis: In the last months of her life, Roslyn Grima was fighting in court for the right to sell her home at a tourist park to fund her cancer treatment, but died before that could happen. Now, her children will continue her battle.

title.children: Children take over court battle after cancer victim dies trying to sell home

image.altText: Arabana ranger Zaaheer McKenzie at the site of a spring.

props.synopsis: Environmentalists are calling for mining giant BHP to end its water extraction from the Great Artesian Basin when a major desalination plant is built in South Australia's north.

title.children: Calls for BHP to end water extraction before culturally significant springs are lost

props.synopsis: CIA assassination plots, the Eureka flag and the Sex Pistols — how well do you know this week in history?

title.children: Step back in time and prove how well you know history

image.altText: A close up of a smiling woman.

props.synopsis: There are a lot of misconceptions about voting, particularly among marginalised groups. But these "democracy ambassadors" are working hard to ensure everyone knows their rights.

title.children: Kiki was told she couldn't vote in prison, now she's debunking that myth

image.altText: A man in a yellow and red lifesaver uniform and lady in a suit stand on top of a sandbag wall in front of a building on a beach.

props.synopsis: Inverloch residents are "infuriated" by the Victorian government's delay in spending $3 million in federal funding to help fix coastal erosion.

title.children: Residents furious as FOI reveals failure to act on coastal erosion

image.altText: An airplane flying during the day.

props.synopsis: The first recorded bird strike, when a bird collides with an aircraft, was in the United States in 1905 but now they occur almost daily. Last year, Australia recorded the highest number in more than a decade.

title.children: Australia records highest number of aircraft bird strikes in over a decade

image.altText: a person sits at a desk looking at the new Bureau of Meteorology website

props.synopsis: Federal Environment Minister Murray Watt has asked the weather agency's new boss to examine how the website's cost and redesign went so wrong.

title.children: BOM reveals new website cost $96.5m, not $4.1m as first announced

image.altText: Bunk beds without mattresses. One in the foreground has a pile of clothes or other items on it.

props.synopsis: More than 300 students have been kidnapped in Nigeria's worst school abduction in 10 years, days after a deadly assault on a church service.

title.children: What is behind Nigeria's latest school kidnappings, church attack?

image.altText: A woman in a blazer smiles as she talks to a man.

props.synopsis: Amelia Hamer has been endorsed as the Liberal Party's candidate for the state seat of Malvern at Victoria's 2026 election.

title.children: Former federal Liberal candidate Amelia Hamer wins preselection for Malvern

image.altText: ALBO G20

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump was the only G20 member to boycott the summit in South Africa.

title.children: Trump isolated at G20 with world leaders uniting behind joint declaration

image.altText: A close up shot of blue and white police tape at night.

props.synopsis: Police allege a 16-year-old boy has slashed an 80-year-old man with a knife while trying to steal his wallet in the car park of the railway station in Melbourne's outer east.

title.children: Teen charged after elderly man slashed at Lilydale Station

image.altText: André Corrêa do Lago, COP30 president

props.synopsis: Denial and division have been highlighted in the COP30 deal that makes no mention of cutting fossil fuels but boosts climate aid for developing nations.

title.children: COP30 sidesteps fossil fuels, boosts climate aid for poor nations

image.altText: Images from a protest rally in a park near a parliament building.

props.synopsis: Protesters against a proposed stadium in Hobart says they "don't want the waterfront transformed into Disneyland" and urge parliament's upper house to scrap the project.

title.children: Hobart anti-stadium protest calls on upper house to 'do the right thing'

image.altText: Film still of a very young Mel Gibson wearing a slouch hat

props.synopsis: By the 80s, the story of the Anzacs at Gallipoli had started to fade from the public consciousness. Then an Australian anti-war filmmaker had an idea.

title.children: The Gallipoli story was being forgotten in Australia, until this film

image.altText: A flower farmer holds a wreath as she constructs it.

props.synopsis: Worried you might make a mess, get it wrong or waste your time making a wreath? Read our tips first.

title.children: Make a Christmas wreath with flowers from your garden

image.altText: A very close up photo of Trump with a furrowed brow

props.synopsis: Donald Trump believes the US has the right to strike directly at those it accuses of trafficking drugs — even beyond America's borders.

title.children: 'It's OK with me': Trump threatens to send military into Mexico

image.altText: Wallabies players look dejected after a loss during 2025.

props.synopsis: The Wallabies did not turn the corner this year, as many had suggested, as they instead face a daunting challenge to be competitive at the 2027 World Cup.

title.children: Are there any positives to come out of the Wallabies's winless European tour?

image.altText: A man lifts a trophy after winning a rugby league match

props.synopsis: The draws for next year's rugby league world cups have been confirmed, with a format change on the cards for the men's and women's tournaments.

title.children: Draws confirmed for reworked rugby league world cups

image.altText: Jair Bolsonaro stands outside a house and is seen through a gate

props.synopsis: Jair Bolsonaro has been taken into police custody after the country's Supreme Court found he was trying to escape house arrest.

title.children: Brazil's ex-president Jair Bolsonaro arrested over alleged plot to escape

image.altText: woman standing behind a lectern giving a speech

props.synopsis: Tatiana Schlossberg says the cuts to research made by her cousin RFK Jr, the US Health and Human Services secretary, are disappointing.

title.children: JFK's granddaughter criticises her cousin RFK Jr's policies as health secretary
